resources.string: Good job! You won this game!
Oops! You lost this game. Try again!
Pick your preferred level for this game:

Thanks for stopping by! This application was created by Infinitum Industries. Copyright 2018. 

Scoring Methodologies: 

For Minesweeper, the score of the player is determined as a ratio of the number of mines to the total elapsed time of the game, with a level multiplier applied. The multiplier is 1 for easy, 2 for medium, and 3 for hard. An additional multiplier of 4 is applied to all scores, and then floor rounding is applied to the resulting score. The 3BV score of the board instance is not calculated. 

Boggle is scored according to traditional rules: 

Words with fewer than 3 letters do not earn any points.

3 or 4 letters: 1 point

5 letters: 2 points

6 letters: 3 points

7 letters: 5 points

8+ letters: 11 points

The "Qu" letter combination counts as two letters.

Repeated words are not counted towards the score, even if they are composed from a different distinct combination of tiles.

 About the Author

This project was intended as a proof-of-concept in Android development for a lowly Computer Science undergrad. Find out more about their work on their GitHub Pages site. 

Credits and Acknowledgements: 

Several individuals were instrumental in the development and testing process of this application. @MissElle was kind enough to offer UI feedback. @mchorton was kind enough to ooh and ahh when requested. The Boggle implementation would not have been possible without an existing "dictionary" of English language words; this implementation uses this repo and credit goes to DWYL for making the dictionary publicly available. Cheers!
When you\'re ready, press "Start Game" to begin.
X won the game! Good job X\'ers!
O won the game! Good job O\'ers!
